I have a theory that we could beat 09-10 with like 6 HECS in a row thanks to #jetweirding. Probably not this winter... or maybe not.. but someday before it only rains in winter.

@bpm_dcwx and my zone is 5-9 or 6-10 depending on how you add it up.

This is a really interesting pattern we are just starting. Cold may eventually overwhelm it following the storm after next weekend's storm. But... it prob has potential unlike any I've seen here other than the infamous late Jan-early Feb 2010 stretch.

RT @fotodave: @islivingston just the 10 pm check in, about 2 inches at the bottom of bull run mountain in Haymarket. Maybe slightly more

@Ic3ManDan #2019ing: it cant be worse than #2018ing, hopefully
@wall_cloud @ulmwxr Our speciality. In the 2016 blizzard it snizzled for like 8 hours before backside banding. Painful.
@ulmwxr Hah true. A lot of the best storms you play with the dry slot too. People also forget it can take 18-24 hours for 8 inches to fall.
RT @ulmwxr: @islivingston This is almost as fun as watching wobbles with tropical systems.
This is a storm DCA shouldn't be way lower than other spots. Starts around sunset.. temp quickly below freezing. The worst place to be is downtown on a street somewhere.

@crankywxguy @DTVaWeatherman @whatisthisrds I think I outdid many or most.. it's been a while so I was due. half of my future talk is not entirely serious. I have however been on that second storm ahead period for a while so I'll stay with it I suppose. next week seems hard but we also nail ULLs this year left and right.

@LilyPetsDogs I was tempted to make a specific offer to feds but it still feels #toosoon @WxDeFlitch

@ForecasterEnten Yeah should be close. I’ve been due a forecast idea that works.
Main roads are surprisingly ok must be treatment. Low wind for a snow event. Might have to wake up early gonna be a beauty.
2.5 inches in Cleveland Park #dc. Snowing steadily at the moment. @capitalweather https://t.co/TSbD8U20Fz
@wolfpackwx I should call the station and ask for him

@wxmeddler It was decently cold.. Jan not so much but Feb was rather cold. I think -5ish or so. But we did sorta end winter after the second one then march onward was torch.
This cold looks more impressive than typical so it could certainly overwhelm the pattern. Juicy tho.

@fotodave interesting as it's set to perform and then some.. and then maybe and then some. I dunno if it's just extra moisture in the atmosphere these days or what but next level.

@hbwx hah yea. wind is picking up a bit too finally.
Does look like the bullseye so far is near DC and along 66. Models shifted north into the end so even the last forecasts were prob a little to south. https://t.co/cFfdC0Brg1
Gonna wander at least into the edge of Rock Creek Park in a bit. Not too common you get such a windless snow.. although it's falling due to its own weight at this point.
RT @rms5539: Looks like banding is starting to set up. This should get us the additional 2”ish through the evening https://t.co/nJnrxWILRB
6 was my goal a few days ago. People said lol.
Snow is prob compacting I slept late hah. Don’t go counting ratios before they hatch.
Close to 6” (5.8ish) in Cleveland Park DC. #WinterStormGia #snurlough @capitalweather https://t.co/hlY099DGDZ
@DCsmom51 yes I'd expect at least 8ish here at this rate and looking at radar.. which puts a foot+ in play perhaps.
@Red_Head_Ed yeah I'd suspect I have at least 8 and maybe 10+ by the time I wake up (since it won't be super early at this rate).. 8 hours or so from now. radar looks better every time I check.
@DCsmom51 it has been steadily looking more impressive. snow is too slow for twitter speed.
@Red_Head_Ed it's crazy how many super memorable events we've had in recent years. this might be the best late trend since I've been here.
@DistrictWino @waclark4 @capitalweather yes not a big low so less windy than usual. I was hoping to get out early but I am always up too late....
@Red_Head_Ed Maybe even more radar looks pretty good. I almost made a tweet about all the sad mornings. I have a feeling it will be a little surprising looking for many.
Looks like the wet roads giving way more now. Not sure it has totally stopped snowing since it started.
Pretty good.. prob as banding dependent as anything. DCA can look like other locations when it's actually cold. (although it's not that cold) https://t.co/wNxzTzLNgq
@H2Omaker71 Yeah I was planning on going early but knew it was unlikely. Still plenty left!
RT @publichistory: @islivingston @mattross72 cool. A couple of hours ago I got between 4 and 5 inches at my house in Reston. Now it's about…
RT @Ombresque: Holy boom! Almost 7” in Arlington Heights off #ColumbiaPike and it’s still coming down in huge clumps @capitalweather @isliv…
@mapgirl18 @mattross72 actually thought radar looked better than what I woke up to but no complaints hah.

@publichistory @mattross72 that's prob fine. technically you're supposed to use a snowboard and clear it every 6 hours but I just measure a bunch of spots and take avg basically. as long as it's not grass or something as that adds depth. trashcan tops, car tops, elevated wood etc are good.
Time for some #snowwalk. https://t.co/VAo7nnVBux

A storm like this followed the ideas of those who have been around a while but there is still very little move past what modeling shows in any forecast. I guess they're so good it can be folly not to listen but it does still feel a little too huggy at times.

@TerpWeather the upper level pass was quite ideal overall in many runs. we've been crushing that this winter just needed cold. I still need to look back at last night I went to bed thinking I might wake up to like 8-10 heh.
Radar's looking pretty good for more snow lately. The duration aspect of this storm is quite legit. https://t.co/4dlrWgwRsz
At least when temp is near freezing.
Need big rates during the day even in Mid-Jan. Not a ton of new accumulation lately.

@rms5539 Many do hah. I’m just not sure it’s a one to one comparison on measurements much of the time. The public tends to pad totals a bit imo. A lot of times it’s also like 33 there and 31 in the hills. I did do a ratio once there vs here should update it

@rms5539 This topic makes me tweak sorry. It’s way more representative of downtown than many stations for their city imo. We just have a lot of hills etc. maybe a smidge low who knows. I also measured at like 11a after compaction
